ygData.subject: Re: er
ygData.msgSnippet: Eye candy is what makes alot of people turn into real jerks when going for an item. The Item could be crap, but as long as it looks kewl, someone will pay
ygData.messageBody:
Eye candy is what makes alot of people turn into real
jerks when going for an item. The Item could be crap,
but as long as it looks kewl, someone will pay through
the nose for it. Personally, I would be willing to
carry the weapon around a zone for show if I had a
better weapon, and switch to the good/better one when
entering combat.
As for quests.
Brian you are the one (other than Beld, and a few others
I missed, sorry) that can answer this one. You may
choose not to, or may not be allowed to, but I will give
it a shot.
Is there a Quest out there for SKs that will allow them
to get a title similar to the Paladin Test of Truth in
Freeport? I don't know about you, but I would quest to
get Sir Cronik Khaos (what I want my last name to be) or
Lord Cronik Khaos or whatever an evil title would be as
part of my character.
I started a Paladin a while ago, but hated being human
and dropped it. I only started it because of the tile.
Anyone?


--
Cronik <Brethren of ill Omen>
Left Hand of Thule the Pain Bringer
15th Season Troll SK
Bertoxxulous





>From: Chip Paul <cpaul@...>
>
>Grant Vanderhule wrote:
>>
>> From: Grant Vanderhule <vandergm@...>
>>
>> xilith, the soulfire really ISNT a very good weapon. in fact its
pretty
>> crappy once you get past the eye candy part. sure the stats are
NICE, but by
>> the time you can actually obtain one without a major twink job,
and
>> considering a paladin who wants it more or less has to continue
the quest
>> through most of his paladin career, it is just complete junk when
set beside
>> a mithril 2h sword or a razing sword of skarlton. yes i know those
two
>> weapons are very difficult to obtain, but there is a big difference
between
>> several hours of camping and several months of active questing
:) which does
>> kind of confuse me.. since it is one of the hardest weapons in
the game to
>> obtain (not to mention limited to a specific class) why is it so
chintzy?
>> not asking for an answer, just a not so subtle suggestion that
any sk quest
>> swords be made a bit more utilitarian ;)
>>
>
>It is also a status symbol, and thus important in RP context. I
>also would rather do a month long quest than camp for many hours.
>I am tired of camping, and am really looking for something to work
>on.
>
>And the stats aren't that bad either. Maybe I just think since
>they have two, so should we, but then I guess we get to share
>a few with warriors (Soul Leech should be SK only!)
>
>Xilith
>
